posts.post_content:
Card of the Day, February 1st, 2013  
Now that Gatecrash is all spoiled, I guess I can start doing these again.  
Skullcrack. Where to start. Well I guess I can observe that burn decks, or just RDW in general seems to be playable every other standard. Scars-Innistrad RDW was pretty bad, probably because Zendikar-Scars was so good (how could it not be with [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) around, along with all those delicious burn spells Zendikar Block had?) This card, along with [Vexing Devil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vexing Devil) et. al. gives me hope that we can soon once again start the countdown from 20, or should I say 18 with all these fancy shocklands? Shuts down half of [Sphinx's Revelation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx's Revelation), [Thragtusk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thragtusk)'s bonus, and [Trostani](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trostani) for a turn, among other lifegain in standard. And then it cracks their skull for 3. Pretty good I'd say. 4/5

Posted By: doombladez (2/10/2013 1:51:21 AM)
Rating:

@Doaj: Why? Why would you run this over Incinerate or Pillar of Flame unless you knew for a fact your opponent was running loads of lifegain? Most decks run little to no lifegain and if you're that determined to stop a lifegain deck, run Leyline of Punishment.
Far too situational and since it can only strike players, it doesn't deserve much of a rating.

@Darthparallax: Situational removal is really important for aggro decks and since this can only strike players, cards that can strike creatures or players are much preferable to being able to counter the small amounts of lifegain most decks would run. Aggro is made a lot harder if your opponents can block.
And I know this would be helpful against my lifegain deck but if someone really wanted to stop it, they could just run leyline of punishment.
